data.title: Van Bruggen & Vande Vegte, P.C.: A professional tax and accounting firm in Orange City, Iowa: Orange City
data.text:
Gary Vande Vegte, Managing Partner

CPA, CMA

As the managing partner, Gary oversees firm operations by strategically planning for the future, and communicating our vision and goals throughout our organization. He also represents our firm in the communities we serve.

His professional focus is to provide a wide range of accounting, tax, and consulting services to individuals, agricultural producers & entities, and small businesses in various industry sectors. Gary loves coming to work and particularly enjoys helping our clients capitalize on business opportunities and coaching them through challenging situations. Gary assists owner-operated dairies in the Upper Midwest and Texas, offering consulting, tax services, and accrual basis financial statement preparation. Gary enjoys public speaking engagements at dairy conferences and seminars.

Civic Involvement:

Member of Finance Committee for Orange City Christian School

Volunteer coordinator for youth sports teams

Living Water Community Church Stewardship Team Member

Central Plains Dairy Association Board Member

Education:

Bachelor of Arts degree from Augustana College

Interests and Hobbies:

Golfing

Boating

Attending children's sporting and school events

Judi Van Berkel, Administrative Partner

CPA, MPA

Serving as the firm's administrative partner, Judi enjoys spending time on human resources and marketing efforts. In addition, she enjoys assisting individuals, small businesses, and nonprofit organizations with their tax and accounting needs. Judi feels that our number one asset is our staff and she feels privileged to work with an amazing team of professionals who are uniquely equipped and gifted to serve our client base.

Civic Involvement:

Treasurer of Board of Directors for Bethany Christian Services of Northwest Iowa

Education:

Bachelor of Arts degree from Dordt College

Master of Professional Accountancy degree from University of South Dakota

Interests and Hobbies:

Walking

Reading

Cooking

Playing games and spending time with kids

Matt Van Essen, Partner

CPA, CVA

Matt's areas of expertise are income tax compliance and planning, business valuation services, cash flow and financial projections, and general business consulting. He is a key member of our tax team, specializes in small business and large dairy operations, is certified to perform business valuations, and assists with estate and succession planning. Matt values working as a team with dedicated, knowledgeable professionals in a fun and flexible work environment. He enjoys helping clients work through financial hurdles to reach their goals.

Civic Involvement:

Volunteer coach for city league youth teams

Selected as 2011 "Top 20 Under 40" by Northwest Iowa Review

Member of Board of Directors of Sioux Center Christian School

Education:

Bachelor of Arts degree in Accounting and Business Information Systems from Dordt College

Interests and Hobbies:

Enjoying time with his wife and three children

Golfing

Running

TJ Korver, Manager

CPA

TJ focuses on tax compliance and planning for individuals and entities, specializing in the agricultural sector. He is also part of the dairy team and is involved with financial statement preparation. TJ appreciates the diverse nature of opportunities available in serving clients and the variety of work.

Civic Involvement:

President of Board of Directors for the Orange City Municipal Golf Association, Inc.

Selected as 2016 “Top 20 Under 40” by Northwest Iowa Review

Education:

Bachelor of Arts degree in Accounting from Northwestern College

Interests and Hobbies:

Playing with sons

Golfing

Spending time with family and friends

Brian Moeller, IT Manager

Brian is our firm's IT manager; he enjoys training both clients and staff to use technology, and is very knowledgeable and patient in doing so. Brian has extensive experience with QuickBooks®, Quicken®, and other accounting and tax applications.

Interests and Hobbies:

Nature photography

Camping

Playing with grandchildren

Ray Gibler, Accountant

M.ACC., CPA

Ray is a full-time professor of accounting at a local liberal arts college. He assists us on a part-time basis by researching complex tax issues, preparing and verifying tax returns for individuals, partnerships, and corporations. Ray enjoys the collegiality of working at our firm and appreciates that his colleagues challenge him intellectually. He particularly enjoys finding opportunities to apply his understanding of tax law to particular client situations.

Education:

BS in Accounting from Northwest Nazarene University

MAcc from Washington State University

Interests and Hobbies:

Riding motorcycle

Traveling

Official for Iowa High School football

Katie Wieringa, Accountant

CPA

Katie is primarily responsible for verifying tax returns in the Orange City office. She also tackles special projects for the firm including improving the firm's relationship with local colleges, assisting in targeted mailings, working with the website and social media, and acting as a coordinator for various in-house committees. Katie enjoys working as part of an exceptional team to provide the best service possible to our clients.

Civic Involvement:

Budget Mentor for Love INC

Sunday School teacher

Barb De Boer, Manager

CPA

Barb is a seasoned professional and a manager with our firm. She is a member of the dairy team, and also works in tax planning/preparation and financial statement preparation. Barb enjoys the variety in her work and the day-to-day challenges that come along with her position; she enjoys both her clients and co-workers.

Active in Coffee Break Bible study

Stacie Snieder, Manager

CPA

Stacie works out of the Boyden office, meeting with clients and spearheading staff training there. She enjoys working on challenging projects, whether individual and entity tax returns, payroll tax preparation, financial statement generation, or various other analyses. Stacie appreciates learning something new every day and working closely with accounting colleagues.

Sandie Van't Hof, Office Coordinator

Sandie is the office coordinator for the Orange City location and her tasks are too numerous to mention. In addition to payroll and recordkeeping, Sandie is responsible for the office's invoicing, credit and collections. Sandie enjoys learning new things and the diversity she encounters in every workday. She appreciates getting to know clients and meeting their needs, and she appreciates the fact that her co-workers all have a sense of humor.

Jana Vermeer, Accountant

Jana prepares tax returns, assists with payroll and audits, and is game to help out anywhere else she is needed. She is up for a challenge and looks forward to growing as an accountant. Jana loves being part of a company that has a first priority of serving God, following with a desire to serve people inside and outside of the office.

Civic Envolement

Spending time with family

Listening to her vinyl records

Ashley Schuiteman, Payroll and Accounting Specialist

CPA

Ashley enjoys assisting clients with record keeping, payroll preparation, and quarterly payroll reporting in the Orange City office. She loves developing relationships with clients and being entrusted with their work so she can make their lives easier.

Ellie Vitamvas, Manager

CPA, MAFM

Ellie's responsibilities with the firm range from individual and entity tax preparation to audit fieldwork. She also prepares financial statements, verifies returns prepared by others, and performs various other tasks as needed. Ellie enjoys working in a fun and family-friendly atmosphere and the dynamic environment of public accounting.

Michael is a member of the dairy team and focuses on preparation of financial statements ranging from accrual basis reviews to compilations, personal financial statements and cash flows. He is also involved in tax preparation for entities and individuals. He enjoys getting to know and building relationships with clients as well as his colleagues.

Dee Vander Well, Administrative Assistant

Dee spends her days managing the phones, greeting and assisting clients, processing and assembling tax returns, and scanning, plus whatever else gets put on her plate throughout the day. She is especially appreciated for her cheerfulness and get-to-it attitude. Dee enjoys the fun, friendly environment of VB&VV as well as the variety of tasks she works on daily.

Amanda Verdoorn, Accountant

CPA, MBA

As a senior accountant in the Orange City office, Amanda specializes in employee benefit plan audits. Her other responsibilities include preparing individual, entity, and non-profit tax returns, and assisting with audits, reviews, compilations, and verifying tax returns prepared by others. In addition, Amanda is a vital part of the payroll team. Amanda enjoys being part of a team and is eager to help out with anything that comes her way.

Melanie’s responsibilities in the Orange City office include record keeping, payroll preparation, and quarterly payroll reporting. She enjoys working with both clients and staff to make sure information gets recorded efficiently and correctly.

Sally’s responsibilities with the firm include tax planning, preparation and review for individuals and entities. Sally enjoys being part of a team and appreciates the variety of tasks and continuous learning environment that public accounting brings.
